clinical_study.brief_title: Cognitive Screening and Cognitive Training in Seniors
clinical_study.official_title: Cognitive Screening and Cognitive Training in Seniors

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas at Dallas

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas at Dallas

brief_summary.textblock: This study will provide cognitive screenings for seniors age 50 and older. It will also investigate the benefits of two different cognitive training programs for seniors who have lower baseline performance on memory and/or gist reasoning tests.

detailed_description.textblock: This study consists of two parts which includes cognitive screening and cognitive training. Participants will initially participate in the cognitive screening portion of the study. If qualified, participants will participate in the cognitive training portion of this study which includes additional cognitive communication, neuropsychological testing, and EEG.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in memory or thinking after brain training
primary_outcome.description: To examine short-term effects of treatment on cognition using neuropsychological measures

secondary_outcome.measure: Measures changes in brain wave activity
secondary_outcome.description: Electrophysiological responses will be recorded using event related potential to monitor responses to yes/no stimuli.

arm_group.description: This group will receive the Strategic Memory Advanced Reasoning Training (SMART) program, twice a week for four weeks.
This group will receive the Brain Health Workshop educational program, twice a week for four weeks.

intervention.description: SMART teaches strategies to improve the ability to process information.
Brain Health Workshop provides information about brain health in a seminar format. Topics include: sleep, nutrition, and exercise.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive complaints in the absence of dementia
- Participate in tasks involving motor abilities such as use of at least one arm and hand
- Read, speak, and comprehend English
- At least 50 years of age
- Comprehend simple instructions, perform tasks, and take part in intervention
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not proficient in reading,comprehending, and speaking English
- History of learning disability, stroke, cognitive impairment, major psychiatric illness, alcoholism, or substance abuse
